refsect2.title: rasqal_new_xsd_date ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - make a new XSD date object from a string

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: new datetime or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_free_xsd_date ()
refsect2.para: Destroy XSD date object.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_date_to_counted_string ()
refsect2.para: Convert a rasqal_xsd_date struct to a xsd:date lexical form string.
Caller should rasqal_free_memory() the returned string.
See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/date-canonical-representation

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: lexical form string or NULL on failure.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_date_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Convert a rasqal_xsd_date struct to a xsd:date lexical form string.
Caller should rasqal_free_memory() the returned string.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: lexical form string or NULL on failure.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_date_equals ()
refsect2.para: Compare two XSD dates for equality.

entry.para: address to store incomparable flag (or NULL)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 if equal.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_date_compare ()
refsect2.para: Compare two XSD dates
If the only one of the two dates have timezones, the results may be incomparible and that will return >0 and set the value of the int point to by incomparible_p to non-0

entry.para: address to store incomparable flag (or NULL)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: <0 if d1 is less than d2 , 0 if equal, >0 otherwise

refsect2.title: rasqal_new_xsd_datetime ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - make a new XSD datetime object from a string

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: new datetime or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_new_xsd_datetime_from_timeval ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - make a new XSD datetime object from a timeval

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: new datetime or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_new_xsd_datetime_from_unixtime ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - make a new XSD datetime object from unixtime seconds

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: new datetime or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_new_xsd_datetime_from_xsd_date ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - make a new XSD datetime object from an XSD date

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: new datetime or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_free_xsd_datetime ()
refsect2.para: Destroy XSD datetime object.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_compare ()

warning.para: rasqal_xsd_datetime_compare is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Compare two XSD dateTimes
Deprecated for rasqal_xsd_datetime_compare2() which can return the incomparible result.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: <0 if dt1 is less than dt2 , 0 if equal, >0 otherwise

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_compare2 ()
refsect2.para: Compare two XSD dateTimes
If the only one of the two dateTimes have timezones, the results may be incomparible and that will return >0 and set the value of the int point to by incomparible_p to non-0

entry.para: address to store incomparable flag (or NULL)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: <0 if dt1 is less than dt2 , 0 if equal, >0 otherwise

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_equals ()

warning.para: rasqal_xsd_datetime_equals is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Compare two XSD dateTimes for equality.
Deprecated : for rasqal_xsd_datetime_equals2 that returns incomparibility.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 if equal.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_equals2 ()
refsect2.para: Compare two XSD dateTimes for equality.

entry.para: address to store incomparable flag (or NULL)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 if equal.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_get_as_timeval ()
refsect2.para: Get a datetime as struct timeval
The returned timeval must be freed by the caller such as using rasqal_free_memory().

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: pointer to a new timeval structure or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_get_as_unixtime ()
refsect2.para: Get a datetime as unix seconds

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: unix seconds or 0 if dt is NULL

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_get_seconds_as_decimal ()
refsect2.para: Get the seconds component of a dateTime as a decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: decimal object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_get_timezone_as_counted_string ()
refsect2.para: Get the timezone of a datetime as a duration format string with optional length count
The returned string is owned by the caller and must be freed by rasqal_free_memory().

entry.para: pointer to store returned string length

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: pointer to a new string or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_get_tz_as_counted_string ()
refsect2.para: Get the timezone of a datetime as a timezone string
The returned string is owned by the caller and must be freed by rasqal_free_memory().

entry.para: pointer to store returned string length

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: pointer to a new string or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_set_from_timeval ()
refsect2.para: Set an XSD dateTime from a struct timeval pointer

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_set_from_unixtime ()
refsect2.para: Set an XSD dateTime from unixtime seconds

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_to_counted_string ()
refsect2.para: Convert a rasqal_xsd_datetime struct to a xsd:dateTime lexical form counted string.
Caller should rasqal_free_memory() the returned string.
See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/dateTime-canonical-representation

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: lexical form string or NULL on failure.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Convert a rasqal_xsd_datetime struct to a xsd:dateTime lexical form string.
Caller should rasqal_free_memory() the returned string.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: lexical form string or NULL on failure.

refsect2.title: rasqal_free_xsd_decimal ()
refsect2.para: Destroy XSD Decimal object.

refsect2.title: rasqal_new_xsd_decimal ()
refsect2.para: Create a new XSD Decimal object.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: new xsd:decimal object or NULL on failure.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_abs ()
refsect2.para: Return the absolute value of an XSD Decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_add ()
refsect2.para: Add two XSD Decimals and store in result XSD Decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_as_counted_string ()
refsect2.para: Get an XSD Decimal as a string lexical form with optional length.
The returned string is shared and owned by the dec object and must be copied. If len_p is not NULL, the length of the returned string is stored.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: lexical form string or NULL on failure.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_as_string ()
refsect2.para: Get an XSD Decimal as a string lexical form.
The returned string is shared and owned by the dec object and must be copied.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: lexical form string or NULL on failure.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_ceil ()
refsect2.para: Return the number with no fractional part closes to argument for an XSD Decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_compare ()
refsect2.para: Compare two XSD Decimals

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: <0 if a is less than b , 0 if equal, >1 otherwise

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_divide ()
refsect2.para: Divide two XSD Decimals and store in result XSD Decimal
If the divisor b is 0, failure is returned

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_equals ()
refsect2.para: Compare two XSD Decimals for equality.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 if equal.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_floor ()
refsect2.para: Return the number with no fractional part closes to argument for an XSD Decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_get_double ()
refsect2.para: Get an XSD Decimal as a double (may lose precision)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: double value.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_get_long ()
refsect2.para: Get an XSD Decimal as a long (may lose precision)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: long value or 0 on failure and *error_p is non-0

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_is_zero ()
refsect2.para: Test if an XSD decimal is zero.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 if decimal is zero

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_multiply ()
refsect2.para: Multiply two XSD Decimals and store in result XSD Decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_negate ()
refsect2.para: Negate an XSD Decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_print ()
refsect2.para: Print an XSD Decimal to a stream

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_round ()
refsect2.para: Return the number with no fractional part closes to argument for an XSD Decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_set_double ()
refsect2.para: Set an XSD Decimal value from a double.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_set_long ()
refsect2.para: Set an XSD Decimal value from a long.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_set_string ()
refsect2.para: Set an XSD Decimal value from a string lexical form

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal_subtract ()
refsect2.para: Subtract two XSD Decimals and store in result XSD Decimal

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: non-0 on failure

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_date
refsect2.para: XML schema date datatype (xsd:date)

Examples of timezone fields: "2010-01-02" : timezone_minutes RASQAL_XSD_DATETIME_NO_TZ, have_tz 'N' "2010-01-02Z" : timezone_minutes 0, have_tz 'Z' "2010-01-02+00:00" : timezone_minutes 0, have_tz 'Y' "2010-01-02-01:00" : timezone_minutes -60, have_tz 'Y'

entry.para: minutes +/- against UTC or RASQAL_XSD_DATETIME_NO_TZ if there is no timezone in the dateTime.
time on timeline of first instant of date in timezone
timezone flag: 'Z' if Zulu, 'Y' if has other timezone offset in timezone_minutes , 'N' if there is no timezone

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_datetime
refsect2.para: XML Schema dateTime datatype (xsd:dateTime)
Signed types are required for normalization process where a value can be negative temporarily.

Examples of timezone fields: "2010-01-02T01:02:03" : timezone_minutes RASQAL_XSD_DATETIME_NO_TZ, have_tz 'N' "2010-01-02T01:02:03Z" : timezone_minutes 0, have_tz 'Z' "2010-01-02T01:02:03+00:00" : timezone_minutes 0, have_tz 'Y' "2010-01-02T01:02:03-01:00" : timezone_minutes -60, have_tz 'Y'

entry.para: second 0-60 (yes 60 is allowed for leap seconds)
minutes +/- against UTC or RASQAL_XSD_DATETIME_NO_TZ if there is no timezone in the dateTime.
timezone flag: 'Z' if Zulu, 'Y' if has other timezone offset in timezone_minutes , 'N' if there is no timezone

refsect2.title: RASQAL_XSD_DATETIME_NO_TZ
refsect2.para: Sentinel XSD Decimal timezone value indicating no timezone is present.

refsect2.title: rasqal_xsd_decimal
refsect2.para: Rasqal XSD Decimal class.
